apryraz.bworld

Class BarcenasFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • apryraz.bworld.BarcenasFinder

  • public class BarcenasFinder
extends Object
    This agent performs a sequence of movements, and after each movement it "senses" from the environment the resulting position and then the outcome from the smell sensor, to try to locate the position of Barcenas.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int agentX
      Agent position in the world.
      private int agentY
      Agent position in the world.
      private int barcenasFutureOffset
      First ever literal in future variables concerning information about Barcenas' location.
      private int barcenasPastOffset
      First ever literal in past variables concerning information about Barcenas' location.
      private BFState bfstate
      Current state of knowledge of the agent (what it knows about every position of the world).
      private int currentLiteral
      First ever literal without meaning, free to assign.
      private BarcenasWorldEnv envAgent
      Object that represents the interface for the Barcenas World.
      private ArrayList<org.sat4j.core.VecInt> futureToPast
      Array of clauses that represent conclusions obtained in the most recent call to the inference function, but rewritten using the "past" variables.
      private int idNextStep
      Index for the next movement to perform, and total number of movements.
      private ArrayList<Position> listOfSteps
      List of steps to perform.
      private int numMovements
      Index for the next movement to perform, and total number of movements.
      private org.sat4j.specs.ISolver solver
      SAT solver object that stores the logical boolean formula with the rules and current knowledge about not possible locations for Barcenas.
      private int soundAboveOffset
      First ever literal in present variables related to when sound is gathered above a certain position by the sound sensors.
      private int soundBelowOffset
      First ever literal in present variables related to when sound is gathered below a certain position by the sound sensors.
      private int soundLeftOffset
      First ever literal in present variables related to when sound is gathered on the left of a certain position by the sound sensors.
      private int soundRightOffset
      First ever literal in present variables related to when sound is gathered on the right a certain position by the sound sensors.
      private int worldDim
      Dimension of the world and total size of the world (Dim^2).
      private int worldLinealDim
      Dimension of the world and total size of the world (Dim^2).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BarcenasFinder(int WDim)
      The class constructor must create the initial Boolean formula with the rules of the Barcenas World, initialize the variables for indicating that we do not have yet any movements to perform, make the initial state.

      Builds the initial logical formula of the agent and stores it into the solver object.
      int coordToLineal(int x, int y, int offset)
      Converts a coordinate pair (x,y) to the integer value b_[x,y] of variable that stores that information in the formula, using offset as the initial index for that subset of position variables (past and future position variables have different variables, so different offset values).

      Adds the clause that says that Barcenas must be in some position with respect to the variables that talk about future positions.

      Returns the current state of the agent.

      Adds to formula the clauses related to implications between the sound sensor and not possible positions of Barcenas when the sound is heard above.

      Adds to formula the clauses related to implications between the sound sensor and not possible positions of Barcenas when the sound is heard on the right.

      Loads a sequence of steps to be performed by the agent.

      Uses agent "actuators" to move to (x,y) We simulate this by letting the World Agent (environment) know that we want to move, but we need the answer from it to be sure that the movement was successfully made.
      private AMessage moveToNext()
      Asks the agent to move to the next position, by sending an appropriate message to the environment object.
      private void notInFirstPosition()
      Adds the clauses that say that Barcenas can never (past and future) be in the first position.

      Adds the clause that says that Barcenas must be in some position with respect to the variables that talk about past positions.

      Adds the clauses that say that if in the past we reached the conclusion that Barcenas cannot be in a position (x,y), then this should be also true in the future.

      Checks, using the future variables related to possible positions of Barcenas, whether it is a logical consequence that Barcenas is NOT at certain positions.

      Processes the answer obtained for the query "Is there any sound at (agentX,agentY)?" by adding the appropriate evidence clause/s to the formula and then performing the inference questions to discover new positions where Barcenas is NOT located.

      Executes the next step in the sequence of steps of the agent, and then uses the agent sensors to get information from the environment.

      Stores a reference to the Environment Object that will be used by the agent to interact with the BarcenasWorld class, by sending messages and getting answers for them.

      Adds the clauses related to implications between sound sensor evidence and not possible positions of Barcenas.
      private AMessage soundsAt()
      Sends to the environment object the question: "Is there any sound at (agentX,agentY) ?".

    • Constructor Detail

      • BarcenasFinder

        public BarcenasFinder(int WDim)
        The class constructor must create the initial Boolean formula with the rules of the Barcenas World, initialize the variables for indicating that we do not have yet any movements to perform, make the initial state.
        Parameters:
        WDim - the dimension of the Barcenas World.

    • Method Detail

      • setEnvironment

        public void setEnvironment(BarcenasWorldEnv environment)
        Stores a reference to the Environment Object that will be used by the agent to interact with the BarcenasWorld class, by sending messages and getting answers for them. This function must be called before trying to perform any sort of computation by the agent.
        Parameters:
        environment - the Environment object.

      • loadListOfSteps

        public void loadListOfSteps(int numSteps,
                            String stepsFile)
        Loads a sequence of steps to be performed by the agent. This sequence will be stored in the listOfSteps ArrayList of the agent. Steps are represented as objects of the class Position.
        Parameters:
        numSteps - number of steps to read from the file.
        stepsFile - name of the text file with the line that contains the sequence of steps: x1,y1 x2,y2 ... xn,yn.

      • getState

        public BFState getState()
        Returns the current state of the agent.
        Returns:
        the current state of the agent, as an object of class BFState.

      • runNextStep

        public void runNextStep()
                 throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException,
                        org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
        Executes the next step in the sequence of steps of the agent, and then uses the agent sensors to get information from the environment. In the original Barcenas World, this would be to use the Smelll Sensor to get a binary answer, and then to update the current state according to the result of the logical inferences performed by the agent with its formula.
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if inserting contradictory clauses in formula (solver).
        org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if solver's isSatisfiable operation spends more time computing than a certain timeout.

      • moveToNext

        private AMessage moveToNext()
        Asks the agent to move to the next position, by sending an appropriate message to the environment object. The answer returned by the environment will be returned to the caller of the function.
        Returns:
        the answer message from the environment, that will tell whether the movement was successful or not.

      • moveTo

        private AMessage moveTo(int x,
                        int y)
        Uses agent "actuators" to move to (x,y) We simulate this by letting the World Agent (environment) know that we want to move, but we need the answer from it to be sure that the movement was successfully made.
        Parameters:
        x - horizontal coordinate of the movement to perform.
        y - vertical coordinate of the movement to perform.
        Returns:
        returns the answer obtained from the environment object to the moveto message sent.

      • processMoveAnswer

        private void processMoveAnswer(AMessage moveAns)
        Processes the answer obtained from the environment when asked to perform a movement
        Parameters:
        moveAns - the answer given by the environment to the last move message

      • soundsAt

        private AMessage soundsAt()
        Sends to the environment object the question: "Is there any sound at (agentX,agentY) ?".
        Returns:
        return the answer given by the environment.

      • processSoundSensorAnswer

        private void processSoundSensorAnswer(AMessage ans)
                               throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException,
                                      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
        Processes the answer obtained for the query "Is there any sound at (agentX,agentY)?" by adding the appropriate evidence clause/s to the formula and then performing the inference questions to discover new positions where Barcenas is NOT located.
        Parameters:
        ans - message obtained to the query "Is there any sound at (agentX,agentY)?".
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if inserting contradictory clauses in formula (solver).
        org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if solver's isSatisfiable operation spends more time computing than a certain timeout.

      • addSoundSensorEvidence

        private void addSoundSensorEvidence(int x,
                                    int y,
                                    String sounds)
                             throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
        Adds the information obtained with the sound sensor as appropriate clauses to the formula of the agent (stored in solver).
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of position.
        y - y coordinate of position.
        sounds - direction/s answer to the question "Where does it sound if in (x,y) ?".
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if inserting contradictory clauses in formula (solver).

      • addBarcenasHereClauses

        private void addBarcenasHereClauses(int x,
                                    int y)
                             throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
        When sound sensor gathers sound in all possible positions that means Barcenas is as that certain current position. This method adds the clauses when the previous situation has happened.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of position.
        y - y coordinate of position.
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if inserting contradictory clauses in formula (solver).

      • addCoordToFormula

        private void addCoordToFormula(int x,
                               int y,
                               int sense,
                               int offset)
                        throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException

      • addLastFutureClausesToPastClauses

        private void addLastFutureClausesToPastClauses()
                                        throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
        Adds all the clauses stored in the list futureToPast to the formula stored in solver. Uses the function addClause( VecInt ) to add each clause to the solver.
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if inserting contradictory clauses in formula (solver).

      • performInferenceQuestions

        private void performInferenceQuestions()
                                throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
        Checks, using the future variables related to possible positions of Barcenas, whether it is a logical consequence that Barcenas is NOT at certain positions. The previous is checked for all the positions of the Barcenas World. The logical consequences obtained are then stored in the futureToPast list but using the variables corresponding to the "past" variables of the same positions.

        An efficient version of this function should try to not add to the futureToPast conclusions that were already added in previous steps, although this will not produce any bad functioning in the reasoning process with the formula.

        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if solver's isSatisfiable operation spends more time computing than a certain timeout.

      • buildGamma

        private org.sat4j.specs.ISolver buildGamma()
                                    throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
        Builds the initial logical formula of the agent and stores it into the solver object.
        Returns:
        returns the solver object where the formula has been stored.
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if inserting contradictory clauses in formula (solver).

      • pastBarcenas

        private void pastBarcenas()
                   throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
        Adds the clause that says that Barcenas must be in some position with respect to the variables that talk about past positions.
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if inserting contradictory clauses in formula (solver).

      • futureBarcenas

        private void futureBarcenas()
                     throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
        Adds the clause that says that Barcenas must be in some position with respect to the variables that talk about future positions.
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if inserting contradictory clauses in formula (solver).

      • pastBarcenasToFutureBarcenas

        private void pastBarcenasToFutureBarcenas()
                                   throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
        Adds the clauses that say that if in the past we reached the conclusion that Barcenas cannot be in a position (x,y), then this should be also true in the future.
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if inserting contradictory clauses in formula (solver).

      • notInFirstPosition

        private void notInFirstPosition()
                         throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
        Adds the clauses that say that Barcenas can never (past and future) be in the first position.
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if inserting contradictory clauses in formula (solver).

      • soundImplications

        private void soundImplications()
                        throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
        Adds the clauses related to implications between sound sensor evidence and not possible positions of Barcenas.
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if inserting contradictory clauses in formula (solver).

      • insertSoundAboveImplications

        private void insertSoundAboveImplications(int x,
                                          int y)
                                   throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
        Adds to formula the clauses related to implications between the sound sensor and not possible positions of Barcenas when the sound is heard above.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate related to the sound literal.
        y - y coordinate related to the sound literal.
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if inserting contradictory clauses in formula (solver).

      • insertSoundBelowImplications

        private void insertSoundBelowImplications(int x,
                                          int y)

        Adds to formula the clauses related to implications between the sound sensor and not possible positions of Barcenas when the sound is heard below.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate related to the sound literal.
        y - y coordinate related to the sound literal.
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if inserting contradictory clauses in formula (solver).

                                         int y)
                                  throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException

        y - y coordinate related to the sound literal.
        Throws:

        Adds to formula the clauses related to implications between the sound sensor and not possible positions of Barcenas when the sound is heard on the right.

        Throws:

      • addImplicationToFormula

        private void addImplicationToFormula(int firstPart,
                                     int secondPart)
                              throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
        Adds the implication: firstPart -> secondPart to formula.
        Parameters:
        firstPart - first part of the implication (before the arrow ->).
        secondPart - second part of the implication (after the arrow ->).
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - if inserting contradictory clauses in formula (solver).

      • coordToLineal

        public int coordToLineal(int x,
                         int y,
                         int offset)
        Converts a coordinate pair (x,y) to the integer value b_[x,y] of variable that stores that information in the formula, using offset as the initial index for that subset of position variables (past and future position variables have different variables, so different offset values).
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the position variable to encode.
        y - y coordinate of the position variable to encode.
        offset - initial value for the subset of position variables (past or future subset).
        Returns:
        the integer identifier of the variable b_[x,y] in the formula.

      • linealToCoord

        public int[] linealToCoord(int lineal,
                           int offset)
        Performs the inverse computation of the previous function. That is, from the identifier b_[x,y] to the coordinates (x,y) that it represents.
        Parameters:
        lineal - identifier of the variable.
        offset - offset associated with the subset of variables that lineal belongs to.
        Returns:
        array with x and y coordinates.
